mdRecord.dcterms:title: A sketch of the environs of Charlestown in South Carolina
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Sproule, George, 1741-1817 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Des Barres, Joseph F. W. (Joseph Frederick Wallet), 1729-1824 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Version of the map with statement of responsibility "By Captain Geo. Sproule, Assistant Engineer on the Spot" and imprint date removed, and with the table key expanded to A-L and a-k; uncolored; on Bates paper. [original]
For a description of the variants of this map, see National Maritime Museum Collections Online, entry HNS 163. [original]
From: J.F.W. Des Barres. Atlantic Neptune. [original]
Relief shown by hachures; depths by soundings. [original]
Shows positions of British units involved in the 1780 attack on Charleston. [original]
Table of references identifies movements and major positions. [original]
Shows coastal area from Spencers Inlet southwestward to Edisto Island [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Charleston County (S.C.)--Maps--Early works to 1800
